title: Chuck Schumer Faces Hectic Start to Senate Term
summary: Democrat will lead chamber tackling Covid-19 aid and confirming Joe Biden's nominees; possible Trump impeachment trial looms. WASHINGTON-Sen. Chuck Schumer will face a raft of immediate challenges when he becomes majority leader later this month, after four years leading Democrats in the minority and two months in limbo.

title: Nellie Liang Is a Leading Contender for Senior Treasury Post
summary: Liang, who specialized in financial stability during her career at the Fed, is being considered for the position of undersecretary for domestic finance. Nellie Liang, an economist who specialized in financial stability during her career at the Federal Reserve, is a leading contender for a senior post in the Biden administration's Treasury Department, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Judge Blocks Trump Administration's Proposed Asylum Restrictions
summary: Rule that was set to take effect Monday would have tightened access to humanitarian protection for people coming to the U.S.. WASHINGTON-A federal judge on Friday blocked a Trump administration rule that would have put wide-ranging restrictions on asylum eligibility days before it was set to take effect.

title: Indonesian Boeing Passenger Jet Crashes in Java Sea
summary: Sriwijaya Air jet lost contact with air-traffic controllers minutes after taking off from Jakarta. A Boeing Co. passenger plane carrying 62 people crashed into the Java Sea on Saturday, Indonesian authorities said.

summary: A selection of photos from Jan. 3-9, 2021, by The Wall Street Journal's photo editors. title: Boeing's Legal, Business Challenges Persist
summary: Plane maker faces civil lawsuits tied to fatal MAX crashes and pandemic-driven decline in orders. Boeing Co. title: Covid-19 Takes Toll on Mexican Health Workers
summary: Resume Subscription. MEXICO CITY-Maribel Larios, a nurse and single mother with a pile of debt, volunteered for extra shifts at her local public hospital as Covid-19 raged, despite suffering from obesity and diabetes.

title: Covid-19 Vaccine Rollout Goes Smoothly in Connecticut
summary: State has administered nearly half of allotted doses, compared with about 28% nationally. Connecticut's Covid-19 vaccine rollout has been relatively smooth, health officials said, while the U.S. and many states lag behind their original distribution plans.

title: Fannie, Freddie Tighten Rules for Condos in Vacation Locales
summary: Moves by government-controlled mortgage firms could drive up cost of borrowing to buy units in resort areas. WASHINGTON-Getting a mortgage for a resort-area condo might become more difficult after Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac moved to tighten rules on buildings with many short-term rentals and hotel-like amenities, some Realtors and bankers say.

title: China's New Rules Amp Up Pressure on U.S. Businesses
summary: Rules plan to ban Chinese companies from complying with some foreign laws. HONG KONG-Beijing hit back against recent U.S. restrictions targeting Chinese companies, saying it plans to ban Chinese firms and citizens from complying with foreign laws and sanctions it deems "unjustified."

title: Think Twice Before Refinancing a Student Loan
summary: Federal student loans carry benefits that will disappear if the borrower refinances with a private lender. Low rates are causing many people to consider refinancing mortgage and other debt. But one type of debt you shouldn't touch right now is federal student loans.

title: How to Care for Aging Parents When You Can't Be There
summary: Tech can help with remote monitoring of seniors' well-being, bring peace of mind; 'Alexa, call for help'. She interviewed caregivers over FaceTime and arranged for groceries and medical supplies to be delivered.

title: Companies Examine Capitol Riot for Security Lessons
summary: The siege is forcing organizations to pay closer attention to property and personnel risks, risk management experts say. Companies are adjusting security strategies and reviewing personnel policies in the wake of this week's deadly riot at the U.S. Capitol in Washington.

summary: Public-service loan forgiveness for college loans: How it works and why some borrowers are missing out. Many student-loan borrowers are confused by the basic requirements of federal Public Service Loan Forgiveness, which could lead to missed opportunity.

title: The Steelers' Opponent Has a Covid Outbreak. Again.
summary: The Steelers' season was disrupted when it faced two rivals, Baltimore and Tennessee, who were dealing with outbreaks. Now their playoff opponent, Cleveland, has one, too.. When five members of the Cleveland Browns tested positive for Covid-19 earlier this week, it meant the team had to close its facility and prepare for a playoff game without its head coach and a star offensive lineman, among others.

summary: Luxury car faces stiff competition from Tesla's locally built models. title: The Tiny Satellites That Will Connect Cows, Cars and Shipping Containers to the Internet
summary: In the shadow of giants like SpaceX, more than a dozen startups are building their own globe-spanning networks of nanosatellites, enabling a new kind of everywhere, all-the-time connectivity for people, animals and assets on Earth. Scientists who track the health of Adélie penguins on the ice-covered wastes of Antarctica are managing their cameras from thousands of miles away-via tiny satellites orbiting above our heads.

title: Twitter Bans President Trump's Personal Account Permanently
summary: The president criticized social-media company's decision using official @POTUS account. Those tweets were removed.. Twitter Inc. banned President Trump's personal account, citing the risk of further incitement of violence and closing off one of his main communication tools following the attack on the U.S. Capitol by a mob of his followers.

title: Google Pulls Parler From App Store After Capitol Riot
summary: Tech giants say some content hosted in app seeks to incite violence in violation of rules. Alphabet Inc.'s Google late Friday suspended Parler, a free-speech focused social-media network favored by conservatives, from its app store, and Apple Inc. threatened to do the same in the wake of the U.S. Capitol riot.

title: House Democrats to Introduce Article of Impeachment Against Trump
summary: Article to focus on riot at Capitol by Trump supporters and to accuse president of inciting an insurrection. WASHINGTON-House Democrats plan to introduce an article of impeachment against President Trump on Monday, according to two Democratic aides, as lawmakers intensified calls to remove the president soon before the end of his term after he encouraged a mob that later stormed the Capitol in an effort to disrupt the certification of his election loss to President-elect Joe Biden.

title: The 'Small-Cap Effect' Isn't Dead, After All
summary: New research finds that the tendency of smaller stocks to outperform large-caps over time still exists, but almost exclusively within the S&P 500 itself. Contrary to reports in recent years that the small-cap effect has disappeared, it's actually alive and well. We've just been looking for it in all the wrong places.

title: Fed Raised Interest Rates in 2015 Despite Concerns Over Growth, Inflation
summary: The first rate increase since the financial crisis drew objections but no formal dissent. Then-Federal Reserve Chairwoman Janet Yellen pressed ahead in December 2015 with the central bank's first interest rate increase in nearly a decade despite several colleagues' misgivings over global economic weakness and weak inflation pressures, according to transcripts of the policy meeting released Friday.

title: Hawley Faces Fierce Backlash After Capitol Riot
summary: Missouri senator's objection to election results has drawn widespread condemnation, raising questions about his political future. WASHINGTON-In a secure room where stunned senators were hiding from an angry mob on Wednesday, Sen. Josh Hawley stood in a corner, mostly alone.
